thread.title: Take a dip in Berlin

title: Take a dip in Berlin
text:
Expert Videos Kai Ulrich Mueller/Picture Press/Getty Images 
One of Berliners' favorite summer activities is going to a See , or lake, for a dip. The German capital is surrounded by numerous lakes. These are some of the best places for swimming: Groß-Glienicker See 
Sandy beaches, clear deep water--what more can one ask for? While you splash, you can watch the sail boats go by. You'll find it between Berlin and Potsdam . Kleiner Müggelsee 
In a forest, this family-friendly lake has a tiny, tidy beach. You'll find it in the suburbs of Berlin, in the district of Treptow-Köpenick. Wannsee 
One of the largest lakes in the city is also one of the most popular, complete with wicker beach chairs for rent. Located in the southwestern Berlin borough of Steglitz-Zehlendorf, Germany, you can get there on the Berlin S-Bahn line S1. Some long-distance trains stop at the Berlin-Wannsee railway station as well. Schlachtensee 
A rolling hill leads to this modest lake with a green field dotted with oak trees and lots of bathers. Keep in mind: there will be some nudists. Located in the south west of Berlin. Straußsee 
Handsome Brandenburg city of Straussberg is also home to this idyllic lake with multiple beaches. Related Articles
